fullText: Cherry Jones gives a towering performance as Amanda Wingfield, the delusional Southern belle who refuses to accept that her children have minds of their own.
dtliExcerpt: Cherry Jones gives a towering performance as Amanda Wingfield, the delusional Southern belle who refuses to accept that her children have minds of their own.
bwwExcerpt: This revival of Tennessee Williams' "The Glass Menagerie" arrives on Broadway from Cambridge, Mass., with the excitement usually reserved for "Breaking Bad" and cronuts: It's genius! You need it! Well, not quite. This is a fine evening at the theater, not a divine revelation. The show is a good take on Williams' memory play, and Zachary Quinto and Cherry Jones offer interesting spins on familiar characters - even if Jones' execution doesn't match her concept of the role.
